bioghist.p: In 1906, through the initiative of church forces in New York City, Waldensian interest groups were invited to coalesce into a new entity, the American Waldensian Aid Society (AWS), organized “to collect funds and apply the same to the aid of the Waldensian Church in Italy and elsewhere…and to arouse and maintain interest throughout the US in the work of said Church…” Today, this organization continues as the American Waldensian Society.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the American Waldensian Society and its local branches. Materials from the offices of directors of the Society include: incoming and outgoing correspondence of Executive Directors Charles W. Arbuthnot, Gilbert Colgate, Frank Gibson, Genevieve Lowry, and Harold B. Noyes; subject files; annual reports; and newsletters and pamphlets. The correspondence discusses financial matters, tours and visits, aid to churches and individuals, and society business. There are also minutes of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors, including reports, articles of incorporation, and by-laws. Financial records include bequests, bank and investment statements, remittances and transmittals, audit reports, and tax records. Records related to branches of the Society include: correspondence, reports, and lists of contributions, as well as files on visits and tours. There is additional documentation of the Montclair branch of the society, including minutes and scrapbooks of invitations, announcements, and clippings. The collection also includes material (some in French and Italian) relating to publication of the book You Are My Witnesses, including pages of translations, correspondence, and drafts; letters to Mrs. Gilbert Colgate, circa 1908; photographs and photo albums; and pamphlets on the Free Christian Church of Italy and the Evangelical Church of Italy, 1853-1890, one in French. These pamphlets predate the formation of the American Waldensian Aid Society; they appear to have belonged to the Evangelical Church of Italy and the Waldensian Society of Germantown.
